Package com.apriori.generator

Utilities for simulating generators in Java.

See: Description

  • Interface Summary 
    Interface Description
    Generator.Output<T,U>
    Represents the output of a generated sequence.
    Sequence<T,U,X extends Throwable>
    Represents a sequence of items produced by a Generator.
    UncheckedSequence<T,U>
    A sequence that does not throw checked exceptions from calls to Sequence.next().
  • Class Summary 
    Class Description
    Generator<T,U,X extends Throwable>
    Provides generator functionality in Java.
    UncheckedGenerator<T,U>
    A Generator that does not throw checked exceptions during generation.
  • Exception Summary 
    Exception Description
    SequenceAbandonedException
    An exception thrown in the generator thread to indicate that the corresponding sequence has been abandoned.
    SequenceFinishedException
    An exception thrown during generation of a sequence of elements.

Package com.apriori.generator Description

Utilities for simulating generators in Java. These utilities aren't necessarily practical as they work using multiple threads and transferring control back and forth, as opposed to sharing the same thread by capturing and restoring the stack of the generator.
See Also:
Generator
